is the tallest mountain in Saxony and the second highest mountain of the Ore Mountains.

has parking lots, while the upper parking lot has only limited parking spaces. For visitors, a hiking excursion, the journey with a bus or the cablecar system is highly recommended.

is the Fichtelberghaus (a restaurant, cafeteria-style restaurant and a hotel) with its 31-meter-tall viewing tower. The newer portion of the building was opened in 1999, as the former Fichtelberghaus was torn down in 1967. The original Fichtelberghaus was built in 1888, but burnt down on 25 February 1963.
On clear days, one can see to the mountains in the northern Czech Republic (the České středohoří) and into the mountains shared by Poland and the Czech Republic. The area around
and the neighbouring Klinovec mountain are famous for winter sports providing many ski lifts and cross-country ski runs.
